title: Sudan: Warnings of Preparations for More Mass Atrocities in Darfur as Conflict Intensifies Across Sudan
description: [allAfrica] Amid ongoing genocidal war in Sudan's Darfur region - two decades after a genocide that mobilized global response - researchers are sounding the alarm about satellite evidence of new barriers being built around areas to which many fled for more safety.  There are fears of a repeat of tactics used in the city of El Fasher last month - documented by the Humanitarian Research Lab at the Yale School of Public Health - where residents who failed to escape in time were surrounded,

title: Guinea Bissau: Guinea-Bissau Electoral Commission Says Poll Results 'Destroyed' in Coup
description: [RFI] Guinea-Bissau's electoral commission says that it cannot publish the results of last week's contested election as the vote counts have been destroyed in an attack. The military took control of the country a day before the provisional results were due to be announced.

title: Ghana: $14m Safe Water Project Launched
description: [Ghanaian Times] A 14-million-dollar water project aimed at expanding access to safe drinking water in parts of northern Ghana has been launched to improve water delivery and strengthen investment in the country's water sector.

title: Kenya: Kenya Abstains From UN Vote Compelling Russia to Return Abducted Ukrainian Children
description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Kenya on Wednesday abstained from voting on a United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) resolution demanding that Russia "immediately, safely and unconditionally" return Ukrainian children taken from occupied territories or deported since 2014.

title: Africa: All of Africa Today - December 4, 2025
description: [allAfrica]

title: Kenya: Nairobi On the Brink As Budget Cuts and Pending Bills Cripple County Services
description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Nairobi County is teetering on the edge of financial paralysis, with shrinking budgets, exploding pending bills, and collapsing essential services, according to a new analysis by the Kenya Human Rights Commission (KHRC).

title: Sudan: U.S.  President Trump 'Personally Overseeing' Efforts to End War in Sudan - Washington Warns of 'Consequences' If Russian Red Sea Naval Base Allowed
description: [Dabanga] Washington D.C. / London / El Fasher / Port Sudan -- US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has stated that President Donald Trump is personally overseeing efforts to end the war in Sudan, UK Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper on Tuesday said that the country requires a "global push" for peace, while the UN Humanitarian Coordinator for Sudan, Denise Brown, warns that killings of civilians continue in several Sudanese cities under siege by Rapid Support Forces (RSF), which are preventing humanitarian aid from reaching those in need.

title: Sudan: Sudan's Crisis Deepens With Communities Trapped in 'Siege Conditions'
description: [UN News] Civilians across Sudan's Kordofan region are facing extreme hardship as conflict intensifies, warned the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) on Wednesday.

title: Africa: G20 Summit - Norway Reaffirms Support to Africa's Development With Nok 3.1 Billion Pledge to the African Development Fund's Seventeenth Replenishment
description: [African Development Bank (AfDB)] Norway reaffirmed its long-standing commitment to Africa's low-income countries with a NOK 3.1 billion pledge to the African Development Fund's seventeenth replenishment (ADF-17). The announcement, made during the Global Citizen Now: Johannesburg event, held on 21 November, was later reiterated in a bilateral meeting between Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre and African Development Bank Group President Dr Sidi Ould Tah.

title: Africa: Africa Sets Course for Affordable, Quality Medicines With New 10-Year Roadmap
description: [WHO-AFRO] Pretoria -- African leaders and global partners have agreed on a bold 10-year regional vision to redesign how essential health products are financed, produced, and delivered, marking a major step toward ensuring that everyone in the African Region can access affordable, quality-assured medicines and health technologies.

title: Africa: United States Temporarily Suspends Visa Applications From 19 Countries
description: [Shabelle] Washington, December 3, 2025 -- The United States government has temporarily suspended all visa applications from 19 countries, according to a statement released Wednesday.

title: Algeria: Algerian Court Increases Jail Time for French Journalist Convicted of 'Terrorism'
description: [RFI] A court in Tizi Ouzou, in eastern Algeria, on Wednesday announced a ten-year sentence in the appeal trial of French sports journalist Christophe Gleizes, accused among other things of "glorifying terrorism". Arrested in May 2024, he has been detained since his trial in June, when he was originally sentenced to seven years in prison.

title: Nigeria: Senate Confirms General Christopher Musa As Defence Minister
description: [Leadership] The Senate has confirmed the nomination of former Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), General Christopher Musa (rtd), as Nigeria's new Minister of Defence after a rigorous five-hour screening session on Wednesday.

title: Sudan: RSF's Ruthless Attack On Zamzam Camp Should Be Investigated for War Crimes
description: [AI London] Sudan: RSF's ruthless attack on Zamzam camp should be investigated for war crimes

title: Mali: Hostage Video Shows Abducted Malian Journalists Asking for Help
description: [RFI] Two journalists from Mali's state broadcaster ORTM have appeared in a video released by the armed Islamist group JNIM, more than six weeks after they were abducted in the centre of the country. Collgeaues have described the images as shocking.

title: Angola: Debunking the Myths of the Lobito Corridor
description: [Maka] Luanda -- If hypocrisy needed a railway, it would look exactly like the Lobito Corridor. It is being hailed as a symbol of African progress. In truth, it is a mirror of everything negative the continent endures: Chinese debt, Western opportunism, Congolese blood, Angolan misrule--and a railway that connects foreign interests more efficiently than it connects the people who live along its tracks. It promises prosperity while delivering the same old extraction dressed in new flags.

title: Sudan: Acacia, Talh, and Heglig Seeds Sown Across 2,700 Feddans to Restore Al-Ain Forest
description: [SNA] Obied -- The Forests National Corporation (FNC) in North Kordofan State has begun sowing acacia, talh, and heglig seeds across 2,700 feddans this season in the Miyiyat, Kitr, and Berak areas of Al-Ain Forest in the Wad Al-Baga area. Miyiyat are small soil basins designed to collect and retain rainwater, while Berak (singular: Birka) are natural rainwater catchments--both serving as essential water-harvesting features that enhance seed germination and seedling survival in dryland restoration.

title: Africa: Africa Investment Forum Secures $15.3 Billion, 39 Bankable Projects At 2025 Rabat Gathering
description: [African Development Bank (AfDB)] The 2025 Africa Investment Forum (AIF) Market Days wrapped up on Friday in Rabat, Morocco, with $15.3 billion in investment interest covering 39 bankable projects, underscoring a growing global appetite for African opportunities.

title: Kenya: British High Commission Protests Omission of Its Responses to Batuk Inquiry
description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The British High Commission in Kenya has expressed disappointment after its formal submission to a parliamentary inquiry into the British Army Training Unit Kenya (BATUK) was not reflected in the final report released by the National Assembly's Defence, Intelligence and Foreign Relations Committee.

title: Botswana: Mojadigo Conspiracy to Defeat Ends of Justice Case Continues
description: [Botswana Daily News] Gaborone -- Rape and defilement accused pastor, Goitsekgosi Mojadigo, who is also the leader of Divine Anointing Church International, failed to appear before Broadhurst Magistrate court on Thursday for a status hearing on the matter in which he and others are accused of interfering with witnesses.

title: Africa: Thousands Could Be Displaced in DRC By EU Backed Lobito Corridor Railway
description: [Global Witness] Up to 6,500 people could be at risk of eviction by the flagship project, a new Global Witness investigation reveals

title: Africa: No Evidence That Boiling Coca-Cola With Red Onion Will Fight Flu Quickly
description: [Africa Check] IN SHORT: A video circulating on Facebook claims that boiling Coca-Cola with red onion and drinking it warm can cure influenza. While the drink may feel soothing, there is no evidence that this home remedy has any medicinal effect.

title: Kenya: Ignore Manipulated Video of Former Kenyan President Kenyatta Calling 2022 Election of President Ruto a 'Mistake'
description: [Africa Check] IN SHORT: Kenya's former president Uhuru Kenyatta did not say Kenyans made a "mistake" in electing president William Ruto in 2022. The viral video of Kenyatta seemingly making these remarks has been altered.

title: Namibia: When Space Touches Earth - the Meteorite That Refuses to Get Hot
description: [Namibian] On a scorching summer afternoon at Grootfontein, Namibia, a curious paradox greets every visitor to the Hoba meteorite.

title: Kenya: Residents Block Sigalagala-Musoli Road Over Gold Mining Concerns
description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Traffic along the Sigalagala-Musoli Road in Ikolomani, Kakamega County has been disrupted, as residents protest a planned public participation meeting which is intended to discuss recently identified large-scale gold deposits in the region.

title: Africa: Lyvv Cosmetics Launches on Amazon in the United States, Canada and Mexico
description: [InfoWire] Lyvv Cosmetics announces its official launch on Amazon, making the brand now accessible to consumers across North America, including the United States, Canada and Mexico. Presented under the identity Maison Lyvv, this expansion marks a major milestone in the international development of the brand, born in West Africa and now entering the world's largest beauty marketplace.

title: Nigeria: First Volunteer Receives Lassa Fever Vaccine in Cutting-Edge Oxford Trial
description: [Nigeria Health Watch] The Oxford Vaccine Group has vaccinated the first volunteer in a first-in-human trial of a Lassa vaccine The CEPI-funded trial is being conducted in Oxford, with a second phase 1 trial due to start in Ghana early next year The World Health Organization (WHO) has identified Lassa fever as a priority pathogen in urgent need of research and development because it poses a significant public health risk due to its epidemic potential.

title: Zambia: Zambia Leads One Health Push Ahead of Regional Conference
description: [Southern and Eastern Africa One Health Conference] In the lead-up to the Southern and Eastern Africa One Health Conference 2025 (11-12 December 2025, Lusaka), the Zambia National Public Health Institute (ZNPHI) is playing a pivotal role. The following interview with Prof. Roma Chilengi, Director General at ZNPHI, explores Zambia's One Health leadership, how national action links to regional momentum, and what delegates might expect to see emerge from the conference.

title: EBID opens first regional office in Abidjan to boost West African development
description: The ECOWAS Bank for Investment and Development (EBID) has taken a major step in strengthening its presence across West Africa with the opening of its first Regional Office in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire. The move aims to bring the Bank closer to Member States, private sector partners, and civil society, accelerating regional development projects and fostering greater cooperation across the ECOWAS sub-region.

title: Vodacom snaps up 20% more of Safaricom in $2.1bn deal
description: The South African telco will own 55% of Safaricom after buying further stakes from the Kenyan government and parent Vodafone.

title: Standard Bank Representative Office first to be re-licensed under Ethiopia's new banking proclamation
description: Standard Bank's Ethiopian Representative Office has become the first foreign financial institution to be re-licensed under the country's revised Banking Business Proclamation, reinforcing the bank's commitment to supporting local businesses and Ethiopia's wider economic reforms.

title: The most asymmetric opportunity of the decade
description: Three years into the AI revolution, generative AI has already created an estimated $24 trillion in value and transformed global markets. But as hype gives way to strategic reality, investors face a critical choice: pursue disciplined, monetisation-focused exposure or risk being left behind in the most asymmetric opportunity of the decade.

title: Rule of law or revenge? Senegal graft crackdown divides opinion
description: Senegal has pledged a war on corruption, but critics say that opposition figures are being disproportionately targeted.

title: African banks embrace AI as digital transformation accelerates
description: African banks are entering a decisive phase in their digital transformation journeys, with Artificial Intelligence (AI) and cybersecurity emerging as twin pillars of innovation and resilience. That's the central message of a new landmark report published by Backbase, the AI-powered banking leader, in partnership with African Banker magazine.

title: Thiam: from business to politics - and back again?
description: The intriguing memoir by Tidjane Thiam, one of Africa's most prominent global CEOs, spans the world of high finance and low politics.

title: Sound macroeconomics underpins CRDB's spectacular growth
description: Riding a wave of growth, Prof. Neema Mori, the new Chairperson of Tanzania's biggest bank outlines the building blocks of the bank's success, its growing international presence and its plans for building a 'futuristic bank'. Omar Ben Yedder met Prof. Mori, who is also the Chairperson for the board of Air Tanzania Company Limited (ATCL), on the sidelines of the October World Bank meetings in Washington, D.C.

title: Nigeria wields ban in bid to beautify shea nut industry
description: A raw shea nut export ban is intended to encourage local processing of the beauty ingredient in Nigeria, but harvesters say they have been hit.

title: Africa's air fleet will more than double by 2044, says Boeing
description: The US aircraft giant says that Africa's fleet will expand in line with domestic and short-haul international networks.

title: Overthrow of Madagascan government complicates mining outlook
description: The future of the country's mining sector is uncertain after the installation of a military-led government.

title: The power of together: How ecosystems are shaping the future of fintech in Africa
description: Africa's fintech industry has entered a new phase defined not by isolated innovation but by the strength of the ecosystems that support it. As regulators, banks, telcos, investors, and startups increasingly collaborate, a continent-wide architecture for scale, resilience, and inclusion is beginning to take shape.

title: Violent elections cast shadow over Tanzania's economic outlook
description: Tanzania faces the potential withdrawal of donor support after an election marked by the killings of protestors.

title: Europe backs African push to get more value from critical minerals
description: Europe has finally backed Africa's push for value-added industrialisation and embraced new tools to fix its delivery gap.

title: Strengthening Africa's AI Foundations
description: Africa's AI future depends on strategic investments in connectivity, computing, local data, and skills. The World Bank's 2025 report shows how small, localised AI solutions can drive innovation tailored to the continent's needs.

title: Trump says South Africa will be barred from next year's G20
description: Trump said that South Africa will not be invited to the 2026 G20 at his Miami resort as tensions spiral following his Johannesburg boycott.

title: G20 leaders renew support for special initiative to boost FDI flows to Africa
description: At the G20 summit, leaders reaffirmed their support for the Compact with Africa (CwA), an initiative that seeks to strengthen business environments, de‑risk investment, and boost foreign direct investment flows across the continent.

title: South Africa's G20 conference bonanza
description: Although hosting the G20 presidency was costly, South Africa gained increased global recognition and visibility, along with economic benefits.

title: South Africa's G20: Europe seeks new alliances in the Global South
description: The G20 Summit marked a new chapter in relations between Europe and the Global South. Despite the US boycott, European countries and EU institutions participated in full force, signalling a clear willingness to reset the relationship on new terms.

title: G20 helps to drive Africa's integration agenda
description: South Africa's G20 presidency has been significant not just for the country itself, but for its potential impact on the whole of Africa, placing the African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) firmly at the centre of its agenda.

title: Mixed results for Africa in Belém as Brazil's COP30 concludes
description: The continent secured some of its key demands on adaptation finance, although the devil may be in the detail.

title: What the G20 declaration means for the host continent
description: The Leaders' Declaration suggests Ramaphosa delivered on his promise: Africa is not peripheral but central, referenced throughout its 29 pages as it advances key African priorities - from security and debt to climate, energy, value chains, AI and cross-border infrastructure.

title: Neville Matjie: South Africa triumphs in G20 presidency
description: South Africa's successful G20 presidency, and its leaders' summit in particular, has boosted the country's global image, tourism markets and national pride, says Neville Matjie, CEO of Brand South Africa, the government's brand agency.

title: The rise of AI agents and what it means for Africa
description: AI agents-autonomous software that can perceive, reason, and act-are set to transform Africa's digital landscape. By bridging service gaps and enabling local, multilingual solutions, they offer a unique opportunity to modernise business, public services, and everyday life.

title: A new centre of gravity: South Africa's G20 presidency and the rise of Africa's global voice
description: Despite the absence of the United States, the Summit was shaped by South Africa's leadership and Africa's growing confidence, underscoring the continent's readiness to assert its independent voice in global governance.

title: How Tchiroma’s Fulani ties to The Gambia’s president helped him escape to Banjul

title: 5 players to watch at AFCON 2025

title: The bulldozer methods of Adanech Abiebie, the mayor remodelling Addis

title: How the West is losing the visa war
description: Tough talk on borders may win elections, but incoherent visa rules are costing Western economies the young talent and skills they need – and handing the initiative to the rest of the world.

title: West Africa’s city champions feel the heat
description: Though none of the region’s cities are in our top five, Abidjan, Lagos and even Cotonou could very well feature next year.

title: Ethiopia launches fiery attack on Egypt over Nile water rights
